articles.headline: Murdochs’ TV Deal in Britain Hinges on 3 Words: ‘Fit and Proper’
articles.snippet: A regulatory standard complicates a bid by Rupert Murdoch and his family, owners of the scandal-plagued Fox News, to gain complete control of the Sky satellite and cable network.
articles.abstract: A regulatory standard complicates a bid by Rupert Murdoch and his family, owners of the scandal-plagued Fox News, to gain complete control of the Sky satellite and cable network.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For most of the last 10 years, the Murdoch family, which controls 21st Century Fox, has wanted one thing for its global media empire above all else: the complete ownership of the popular and highly profitable Sky satellite and cable network.

articles.headline: Bipartisan Agreement Reached to Fund Government Through September
articles.snippet: Congressional leaders reached a spending agreement on Sunday, aides from both parties said, effectively ending the threat of a government shutdown next weekend.
articles.abstract: Congressional leaders reached a spending agreement on Sunday, aides from both parties said, effectively ending the threat of a government shutdown next weekend.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional leaders reached a bipartisan agreement on Sunday to fund the government through September, effectively ending any suspense about the possibility of a government shutdown next weekend.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Matt Flegenheimer

articles.headline: Trump Discards Obama Legacy, One Rule at a Time
articles.snippet: The president, using an obscure law, has signed 13 bills that erased Obama-era rules in areas like the environment, financial protections, internet privacy and gun rights.
articles.abstract: The president, using an obscure law, has signed 13 bills that erased Obama-era rules in areas like the environment, financial protections, internet privacy and gun rights.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just days after the November election, top aides to Donald J. Trump huddled with congressional staff members in Speaker Paul D. Ryan’s suite of offices at the Capitol. The objective: not to get things done, but to undo them — quickly.

articles.headline: John Paulson’s Fall From Hedge Fund Stardom
articles.snippet: The hedge fund Paulson & Company manages just under $10 billion today, down from $36 billion in 2011.
articles.abstract: The hedge fund Paulson & Company manages just under $10 billion today, down from $36 billion in 2011.
articles.lead_paragraph: John A. Paulson is one of the best-known names in the hedge fund industry. But these days, Mr. Paulson is having more success in the political realm than he is managing his business.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: In Palestinian Power Struggle, Hamas Moderates Talk on Israel
articles.snippet: The militant group that has engaged in violent resistance against Israel is pushing for closer ties to Egypt and says it would accept a provisional Palestinian state.
articles.abstract: The militant group that has engaged in violent resistance against Israel is pushing for closer ties to Egypt and says it would accept a provisional Palestinian state.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Hamas, the militant group built around violent resistance to Israel, sought on Monday to present a more moderate public face, taking its next shot in an intensifying struggle for leadership of the Palestinian cause and international recognition.
